Hi, please subscribe to the mailing list, Dubbo 3.0 development is discussed there.
I am closing this issue for now. Feel free to reopen it you are still getting this.

Hi,

I noticed the two alternative for Redis Client: Jedis and Redisson, they are both recommended on the official Java client for Redis [1]. They both have their advantages.

Do you have any performance evaluation for these two clients?

Unless you have provided enough information, we can't make the decision  to replace Jedis with Redisson.

p.s. Uploading a zip file is not recommended, please use pull request instead. see https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md for more details.


[1] https://redis.io/clients#java

Hi, 

I am afraid that there isn't a way to do so.

Since you can specify multiple container, how can you know which args should go with which container?

e.g. 

```
java -jar my.jar container1 container2 container3
```

How to specify args for container2?

Maybe sth. like this:

```java
java -jar my.jar -container containerA arg1 arg2 -container containerB arg1 arg2 
```

But this may require change for the current code, also you need consider the compatibility. Therefore it is kind of difficult.

Do you have interested in implement this feature? Please let me know.

What I can suggest is using system properties instead for now.

A bug same as ：
https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/issues/146

close this via https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite/pull/2
close this via https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite/pull/2. You can have a try

https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite/pull/1 was merged 

And 2.5.x and 2.6.x will remove hessian-lite module via https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/pull/2074 and https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/pull/2073 , use https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite directly. so close this pr

If milestone 2.6.3 will use this feature, should release  https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite, and upgrade the hessian-lite version of 2.5.x and 2.6.x  branches

Hi, this is fixed in the master branch, I think it should be back ported to 2.6.x branch. @beiwei30

@L-Angel I think you need to set the url as `dubbo://127.0.0.1:20882?hello.1.callback=true`.

By the way, the callback invoke mechanism can export only one callback service provider, and then the provider side refer the callback service to invoke with sync or async. So your demo is not correct, you can only register the callback once. 

Maybe this blog can help you understand the callback invoke mechanism. http://dubbo.apache.org/#/blog/dubbo-invoke.md?lang=zh-cn

Feel free to reopen it.

@L-Angel 

I think there has two steps to use callback invoke mechanism:
1. register the callback, then provider side hold this callback service
2. the provider trigger invoking callback service with suitable time

Check this sample: https://github.com/dubbo/dubbo-samples/tree/master/dubbo-samples-callback
The EDAS on Alibaba Cloud is compatible with Dubbo for the two features you mentioned. You can refer EDAS documentation for more information.

Hi, I think @diecui1202 's comments clearly answered this question, I am closing it now.

QOS can be disabled by programmable API in ApplicationConfig#setQosEnable, therefore is should be configurable if you are using Java API.

If you are running Dubbo in [spring-boot](https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo-spring-boot-project), you can configure in application.properties:

```
dubbo.application.qos.enable=false
```

For XML configuration, I think we can't disabled for now, that is task to be fixed.

You can work it around by specifying another port in dubbo.properties.

```
dubbo.application.qos.port=33333
```
